SSYLabelledList Class Reference

This class provides a control which consists of a non-editable NSTextField label and, below it, a non-editable list of strings (choices), displayed in an NSScrollView+NSTableView. The height of the scroll/table is adjusted to fit the content, up to a given maximum table height. More...

Detailed Description

This class provides a control which consists of a non-editable NSTextField label and, below it, a non-editable list of strings (choices), displayed in an NSScrollView+NSTableView. The height of the scroll/table is adjusted to fit the content, up to a given maximum table height.

May be used, for example for a user to select several items from a list.

Member Function Documentation

+ (SSYLabelledList *) listWithLabel: (NSString*)  label
choices: (NSArray*)  choices
maxTableHeight: (float)  maxTableHeight 

Convenience method for getting an autoreleased instance of this class.

Parameters:
label The string in the label which will appear above the list in the returned instance.  In most cases, append a localized version of "Hold down the 'shift' or \xe2\x8c\x98 key to select more than one." (Or instead of escapes, use C format specifier with substution 0x2318.)
choices An array of strings, to appear in the list
maxTableHeight The maximum height allowed of the scroll/table view.
Returns:
The instance, autoreleased

- (void) setAllowsMultipleSelection: (BOOL)  flag  

Sets whether or not the receiver's table view allows a multiple selection.

If not set, defaults to YES.
